A mere 209 of these cars were built for this market, so
is a big deal. This street-legal model comes with a turbocharged boxer 4-cylinder engine pumping out an amazing 341-horsepower. With that engine under the hood, the

charges from 0-60 mph in just over 4 seconds, so it’s plenty quick. If that’s not enough to get you excited, know this car also comes with a 6-speed manual transmission, so you can employ all your three-pedal skills while behind the wheel.

Of course, it also comes with Subaru’s famous all-wheel drive for fun times all year long. Capitalizing on that technology are numerous chassis and body tweaks infused by STI engineers to improve handling even further. For example, this car is almost 2 inches wider than the WRX STI Nurburgring Challenge, a purpose-built racecar and not a road-legal vehicle, which translates into even better handling and high-speed stability. That greater width means room for 19 x 9-inch BBS forged alloy wheels with Dunlop 265mm tires for extreme grip.
